description: The top level of the graph

edges.title: edges
edges.description: The list of edges in this graph

reverse.description: flag for reverse lookups.  Assume False by default.

items.title: sameAs
items.description: indicates that a vertex may be the same as another; should include some confidence score

vertices.title: vertices
vertices.description: The list of vertices in this graph

items.title: user
items.description:
legitimate, authorized user of some system(s) 
A user owns, is assigned, and/or uses some hardware. 
A user has an associated account.

items.title: account
items.description:
account on some specific system(s), either belonging to some specific user or a system account 
All software runs as some account. 
All accounts are associated with a user or users (such as system accounts.)

items.title: host
items.description: Any entity on the network, including PCs, routers, switches, virtual machines, etc.

items.title: software
items.description: Any software components on a system, including OSes, applications, services, and libraries.

items.title: vulnerability
items.description: a flaw in some software, that can cause improper, unintended operation, and can potentially be exploited as part of an attack

items.title: address
items.description: any address, either inside or outside of the network

items.title: DNSName
items.description: a DNS name (and possibly associated info - registration info, etc.)

items.title: service
items.description: expected or actual service using some port

items.title: malware
items.description:
any malicious software.  This can refer to either a stored binary or a running instance. 
Malware can contain code to launch an exploit. 
Malware can itself be an asset that an attacker uses in future attacks (eg. a backdoor left on a compromised system.) or can automatically launch additional attacks on behalf of the original attacker. 
Malware can be hosted by or communicate with servers controlled by the attacker. 
Malware can contain code to load other malware. 
Malware can reuse components from other malware samples.

avName.description: AV vendor's name for this malware

sha1hashes.description: known SHA1 hashes for this malware family

md5hashes.description: known MD5 hashes for this malware family

filesCreated.description: files that may be created by this malware

filesModified.description: files that may be modified by this malware

registryKeysCreated.description: registry keys that may be created by this malware

registryKeysModified.description: registry keys that may be modified by this malware

discoveryDate.description: date when the first known sample was observed

signatureDate.description: date when the first known signature was created

modifiedDate.description: date that the most recent source document was last updated

overview.description: descriptive summary of this malware family

details.description: additional text description of this malware

behavior.description: description of this malware's observed behaviour

prevalence.description: prevalence of this malware 'in the wild' (currently a descriptive phrase, may convert these to a numeric range later)

distribution.description: known distribution methods for this malware

aliases.description: other known names for this malware family (typically from different AV vendors)

knownFileTypes.description: known file types associated with this file (eg file extensions, mime types, etc.)

processesCreated.description: description of processes created by this malware (eg. executable name with args)

urlsUsed.description: URLs requested by this malware, or URLs distributing this malware, or othewise associated with this malware.

items.title: flow
items.description: a flow of traffic between two addresses

appByteRatio.description: ratio between source appbytes and dest appbytes

flags.description: flow state flags seen in transaction

items.title: attack
items.description: a machine-generated alert of potentially malicious activity, such as from an IDS.
